website_summaries.verdict: Despite its faults, the LG Prime is a nice phone, especially given its price and the fact that you can get it without a contract.
pros: The LG Prime has a customizable home screen, a colorful display, intuitive controls, a music player, a 2-megapixel camera, an HTML Web browser, Bluetooth, and good call quality
cons: The LG Prime's touch screen is a little sluggish, its camera's photo quality is mediocre, and surfing full HTML pages is not a smooth experience

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone !
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why there are so many people having problems with this phone? I bought this for my husband as a Christmas present and he has had not one single problem with it ! The touch screen works just fine and he's been using it EVERY SINGLE DAY since December (2010). His calls are very clear. Much better then with the older AT&T GoPhone he had. The pictures are decent for a 2 MP camera. No problems with texting either. He used his regular contract AT&T Sim card with this phone (not the GoPhone Sim card) and it works like a charm. We give this phone 5-stars !
customer_reviews.author: M.M.

customer_reviews.title: The touch screen will stop working.
customer_reviews.text: My touch screen stopped working and then started working again. Today, it happened again. I went online and did a Google search and found a forum where literally thousands of people were talking about having the same issue with their LG phone. Wish I had had the sense to do the research before I bought the phone. Until the touch stops working, it's a great phone. But what's the use of all the good stuff this phone has if you can't access it because of the faulty touch screen?
customer_reviews.author: BeforeDarknessFalls

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen doesnt mean great phone!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone because i always wanted a Touch screen phone. Little did i know i was happy i had a touch screen but shocked and dissappointed when i learned it is only 2G....... And since i use the internet alot to listen to music this was heartbreaking to me when i couldnt download things that even my old ugly worn out Pantech Intrigue could. I would recommend this phone for children and internet illerate to use. It did come brand new, packaging was GREAT and the $15 bonus was good, but im now looking for another phone to buy.
customer_reviews.author: adennis0042

customer_reviews.title: good, cheap, alternative to pricey contracts
customer_reviews.text: GoPhones are a great alternative to expensive individual plans. Switching phones was a breeze, all I had to do was swap out the sim card from my old phone to this one and I was good to go! Touch screen is pretty consistent and responsive although occasionally it can be laggy. great, durable phone for the money, would definitely reccomend it!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Backhaus

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a quick replacement for my then young son. It served its purpose
customer_reviews.author: Kiya

customer_reviews.title: AT&T LG Prime
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. It's easy to get to know and an upgrade for me but not way beyond what I'm able to figure out. It does everything I need it to do and texting is easy as can be. It's everything I was looking for and so far, performance has been perfect. Great price with just enough features for me.
customer_reviews.author: T Dix

customer_reviews.title: Worst Phone in my Life
customer_reviews.text: I never had so much problems with cell phones before, except for this one. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE. The main problem was that it did not send out text (Like most reviews warn you about). I did not bother to look at reviews because I thought that cell phones were somewhat like computers (They're obsolete within 4-5 years or so), so I assumed it would work. I had many important texts to send out and did not realize they were not being sent out until someone told me. Another BIG problem is that you can't return the phone if you open the package, so once you realize its fault its already too late.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Not worth
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this phone for past 4 months, and not satisfied. The voice quality was not good, and signal reception was the worst part. Once the cell phone looses the signal (though signal indicator is displaying 3 bars), I cannot make or receive calls. I have to restart the phone in order to make or receive calls. I am not sure if this happens because of AT&T network, or the cell phone, but together they dont make a good combination for sure. I would say its not worth spending this much money for this phone. Better look for other options.
customer_reviews.author: deepak.singh

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The phone is small and compact. It's easy to carry, but it's also a little hard to hit the button you want because it's so small. I don't find it all that user friendly. I have had other phones that are easier to use, but it's a fine phone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: HonestReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself time and money and STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: Like others have commented, this phone looks cool, but is a ticking time bomb. The touch screen stops working correctly after a few months and then stops working at all within a few weeks of that. I purchased the phone in June 2010 and had to replace it by September of 2010! And the replacement stopped working in January of 2011!! I think that speaks for itself. If you want a touch-screen spend money on a good one. If you just want an affordable, reliable phone try something without a touch screen. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: hdabara

customer_reviews.title: great little phone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for my 14yr old daughter as a birthday gift. She LOVES it.... calls it her mini Iphone....it works wonderfuly well and fits her active life.... the only issue i had with the phone was being an AT&T customer we put in her sim card and it had trouble connecting to the network at first... called AT&T customer service and in less than 10minutes they fix the issue and the phones been working wonderfuly ever since..... so if you have a teenager dieing for an Iphone and need a cheaper alternative i would recommand this phone !
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: LG Prime
customer_reviews.text: The cell phone came in a timely manner and a quick trip to my local AT&T store got it up and running. Also it cost $20 less than buying the same phone at the AT&T store. The phone is perfect for my needs as a casual phone user and gives me a readily available camera that is easy to use. I added a memory card to store my photos for download to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: cage47

customer_reviews.title: workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in November of 2010 and it's still going strong today. I would say that is a testimony to the durability of it. Have only replaced the battery for the first time recently.
customer_reviews.author: az mom

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine for my needs, i just wanted a cell phone in case of an emergency while i was away from home. Thanks, Elaine
customer_reviews.author: elaine green

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT GET THIS PHONE!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is a piece of junk. I got it of of amazon and a couple months later it wasnt working, if i was sending a text i would press a and it would put the letter h on the screen. i decided to take it to the at&t store to trade it in for a new one than after a few months it had the same problem. DO NOT GET THIS PHONE,ITS A PIECE OF JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great price & phone
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this phone almost 2 weeks ago and had it delivered within 2 days of ordering it so that was great. I've only had one issue with the phone and that the phone is was pre-programmed to come with the DTMF tone off. So for the first few days in till I figured it out I could not call my voice mail or use any automated phone system. But other then that it is easy to use and the battery is good. It charges well and the touch screen is also good.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: It don't work right
customer_reviews.text: I got the phone for my boyfriend for christmas. The phone worked for about a month then things went down hill. It would freeze up, then work again so on and so forth. When you are on the phone(voicemail) and when you needed to push a digit it wont work so you couldnt go nowhere in your voicemail. The touch screen itself wouldnt work sometimes. The phone would work then it wont. All in all the phone WAS great then it just DOESNT WORK ANYMORE.
customer_reviews.author: My opinion

customer_reviews.title: easy, affordable, quick shipping
customer_reviews.text: this is not an apple phone. just for someone one who wants the basics but looking for a touch screen. easy to use. affordable. fast shipping. thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Just "ok"
customer_reviews.text: This phone worked alright for a while. It's pretty basic and not very appealing. I liked having a touch screen since I couldn't afford a smart phone. The phone itself is pretty small. The battery life is good, even with my constant texting. After about 8 months with this phone, the touch screen just stopped working and wasn't repairable.
customer_reviews.author: cbmitch

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this phone for our daughters' 11th birthday. It is her 1st cell phone and she absolutely loves it. For the sale price of $79. with $50. airtime, you can't beat it. The full touch screen is awesome and she has a great time texting with friends and listening to the FM radio on it. The picture quality is pretty good also. Would definitely recommend this phone to anyone who is looking for a nice prepaid phone for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Good little phone
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my wife when she droped her other one in the toilet it lasted for quite some time but not long enough
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: LG Prime
customer_reviews.text: good model of a good cell phone maker. held its resale value...
customer_reviews.author: 2-b determined

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: really good and cheap phone for those who dont need all the apps and stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Xem

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Almost went back, would lock up my wife would have to take the battery out and restart it. Was going to go to AT&T store see if it would be fixed or exchanged. Had it in my car to do so but the store went out. Got home turned it on been okay since wouldn't suggest model to anyone. If your looking for a phone try another
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: LG PRIME GREAT INVSTMT
customer_reviews.text: This phone is practical and affordable. It is by a great cell phone company and it comes with many of the tools offered by other devices. The music player is great as is the touch screen service. The only downside is that the camera is not the best quality. Nonetheless, it is effective for capturing still moments with the proper lighting. Overall it is a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Angelus

customer_reviews.title: LG Prime
customer_reviews.text: good phone and good price. it does many things you always do its a great music player. also many people ask me it its a smart phone and they they think it was expensive but it wasn't. good price with free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Alex23

customer_reviews.title: Big Hit With the Daughter!!
customer_reviews.text: We got this phone for our 13 year old daughter, and she loves it! Always finding something new that it does. She hasn't had any complaints..(as of yet) It sounds great while playing music. Takes good pictures, voice is clear while talking. Touch sensitivity is good. overall a good little phone.
customer_reviews.author: browneyedashes

customer_reviews.title: really good phone with good price and service
customer_reviews.text: this phone is really good for starters.I am not used to touchscreen phones and it feels weird for the first day but then you get used to this phone and it is really fun. but I should mention it would have been better with 3G. I uses EDGE and sometimes it takes a little longer to browse website.
customer_reviews.author: mroquw

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I got it yesterday and I am very happy with it! If you are looking for a great deal this is it!!!! You get the new phone plus a $50 airtime credit. The great thing is you don't have to use the new sim card to get the credit. If you are already a go phone user just put your sim card in the phone and it gives you the credit automatically!!! So you keep your old number and are only paying $29.99 for this phone and it is way worth the purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Latesha Zach

customer_reviews.title: Worst phone!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Never buy this phone... Battery dies soon, have to charge frequently even if you dont use the phone. Very poor LG service, I had taken this phone to India and LG service center refused to repair this phone as it was bought in USA. Not worth at all...
customer_reviews.author: Sidd

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I had this phone for a month or two at the most, and shortly after i began to notice problems, the screen completely stopped working on it, the buttons when you would text would completely use a different letter. This phone was a BIG mistake.
customer_reviews.author: iloveyouu

customer_reviews.title: Best Pay-As-You-Go Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. It gives me all the features and functions of an expensive contract phone. I love the touch screen and it's sleek design. Best phone I ever owned. The call quality is excellent, easy send and receive texting and takes decent pictures too.
customer_reviews.author: searcyg

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone almost a week and I love it. It's easy to use. It's not as big as an iphone. It takes good pics. the screen is bright and clear! Touch screen is awesome. No problems or compliants!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: LG Prime
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time and in perfect condition!The LG prime is a great phone especially for being my first touchscreen.Definately recommend it for anyone.Phone was a bit smaller than I thought but Its still a great phone.
customer_reviews.author: mark1

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone in November of 2010 and the phone was working quite well for about 2 months. Then the touch screen went haywire for no absolute reason. I've had this phone replaced 3 times and AT&T won't even give you a different phone or even a phone of lesser value to replace it. They just keep sending me the same phone. So in my opinion this phone is horrible and a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Akeem #ThePrince

customer_reviews.title: Displeased
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone and it went haywire within 5 months freezing right after it is cut on. I Would like to know what to do or who you contact about getting this phone fixed. Do you just trash Go Phones when they mess up?
customer_reviews.author: Paula Thompson

customer_reviews.title: LG Prime GoPhone
customer_reviews.text: I received this product about a week ago. Keep in mind that I am a technological idiot, but this phone was so easy to set up and use. I absolutely love it and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone
customer_reviews.text: This is an overall good phone. There is only one con the fact that the phone is locked and trying to call at&t to unlock it is the hard part.Besides that this is a good touchscreen phone and I have no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Fee

customer_reviews.title: Average phone. Credit for Airtime difficult to get
customer_reviews.text: Phone is good for a basic touch screen phone. AT&T however makes it difficult to get the $15 airtime. Still have not received the credit. Dump the $15 Airtime and charge $15 less for product.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: The new toy was delivered in less than two days with no taxes or delivery charges. Good on Amazon! Good news is it works, transferred all my contacts as soon as I put in the old SIM card and added the $50 free airtime to my prepaid AT&T account automatically without losing my $130 in rollover minutes. Bad news is the dam thing is smarter than I am like my Cadillac and my brain hurts! Overall it looks like it is going to be a good one and service from Amazon was excellent!
customer_reviews.author: hugo

customer_reviews.title: Easy breezy telly
customer_reviews.text: OH, I LOVE my new LG Prime Prepaid GoPhone! Its the best thing since sliced bread :-) You can instantly check on your current balance with just a click of a button and there are so so many other advantages to this phone. The keypad is nice and large and the numbers too. Activation is a snap. The extra airtime that comes with it is also a big boost. Amazon did an excellent job of packaging & shipping -- securely packaged so I received it without any defects. TRY IT YOU'LL LIKE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B.

customer_reviews.title: The phone works just fine. I m able to get a signal inside my hourse with it. That has been a problem with other phones.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is working just fine. Unfortunately the $15 airtime credit has not appeared on my account although I received a message that it was being credited so i am unhappy about that.
customer_reviews.author: burnspop2

customer_reviews.title: no ring
customer_reviews.text: I had the phone for a month. My job requires me to be on call every four weeks. On Tuesday my boss called me to make a delivery. Well the phone did not ring. I found out the next day about me not answering my bosses call. I asked a coworker to call my phone. It did not ring. She made a suggestion to turn off the phone and turn it back on. I did what she suggested and she called the phone again and it worked. Well I'm not happy. I ordered a different phone and a coworker and I destroyed the phone.
customer_reviews.author: oldguy9201

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone
customer_reviews.text: I just recently with to At&t, old provider was Boost Mobile. It was just to slow and didn't receive all my text messages. This phone is great! The only things I dislike about it is the touch screen, its not that sensitivity. You need to put pressure on it for it to work sometimes, but not a big problem. It don't feel that duality, so if your a person that drops your phone often maybe you should rethink about getting this phone. Other than that its a pretty good phone. Camera is okay, not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: Worst LG PRIME
customer_reviews.text: The volume doesnt work. My ringer dont work. I cant hear people when they call. It has a security number so i cant delete anything. I AM GETTING A REFUND DO U AGREE?
customer_reviews.author: Cortrell

customer_reviews.title: Blank Texts
customer_reviews.text: Due to the potential for blank texts sent to anyone not in the AT&T network I wouldn't recommend buying unless you only deal with people in the AT&T network. I've spent hours on the phone with tech support and they always point the finger at different carriers. I've sent texts to sprint and virgin mobile phones and sometimes they go through and other times a blank text shows up.
customer_reviews.author: buck

customer_reviews.title: . Very poor phone
customer_reviews.text: If you don't use with ear piece you will never have a complete conversation.The phone always hang up the call after you say a few words.
customer_reviews.author: Rozelle

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: All around it is a good phone. The only prblem I had with it, I could not access my mobile bank account.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great cell phone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cell phone for my daughter. Once my mother saw it, she also purchased the same phone along with the guard and the screen protectors. Amazon.com has everything I need at a lower price than anywhere else I have shopped at and the quality of the products are great. I would recommend everyone to use Amazon.com for all your shopping needs. Its also very convenient to shop from your own home.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Got this in the beginning of December. I love the ease of use of all the features of this phone, from sending and receiving texts, clearing out old texts with the standard view and the touch screen. Only thing that seems to be a drawback is the battery doesn't seem to stay charged long. If there was a stronger battery this would by far be the best phone I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: asheppard

customer_reviews.title: Bargain phone!
customer_reviews.text: This is far superior to most prepaid phones. Easy to use, many features, especially for the price. The phone has voice command, multiple ringtones, camera, FM radio, alarm clock, unit converter, world clock, tip calculator, calendar, notepad, stopwatch and more. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: It's a good phone,but...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for about a month and a half now and the only problem I have is it freezes up REALLY bad and the touchscreen is often slow or has a delayed reaction... If you like to JUST text and talk this phone is perfect for you because that is all it's good for,texting and talking... the radio feature is pretty cool too... My main "beef" is with AT&T.. Their service sucks.... but $2 a day ,what do you expect?
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Cassanova Jones

customer_reviews.title: Neat little device
customer_reviews.text: I received my phone on time. There were no issues. As far as the device itself...... I am satisfied. It was what I expected. Thanks amazon........ I would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Misssmith39

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone..
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing this phone, I read some bad review about this phone. But I am using this phone for last 1 week, I found this phone working perfectly. Also it was activated immediately also Airtime $50 was credited withing 20 minutes of activation. It has everything what I needed and working fine. I just love this phone. Camera, bluetooth, onscreen keypad is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got my phone. The internet says and amazon say $2 per day only when used. The package says $3 per day. I called one service number after another to find out what the actual price was and was told it was $3 per day plus 10¢ per minute!!!! I returned the phone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Squid

customer_reviews.title: Waste !
customer_reviews.text: That about sums it up ! A Waste of time , money, effort,...... The phone itself looks nice, but it takes some getting used to for an old guy and I found it hard to hold on to. And the Go Plan....just plan to Go and keep refilling your minutes and Paying and paying and paying..... A real waste ! Just setting the phone up and putting stuff into the phone like voice mail,costs money. I had not even made an actual call to anyone and found that I had used almost ten dollars........ I suppose that it has it's uses and fans, but this Go Phone went right back to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: J. Varga

customer_reviews.title: phone
customer_reviews.text: i love this phone my mom got me the phone today i love it and you get 150 free ?
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Super Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love my new lg prime its off the chain could'nt ask for anything better the 50 airtime credit was a great bonus love it.
customer_reviews.author: MsNetta31

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I received this phone yesterday. I charged the battery and put in my old sim card. It works!!! I have yet to get the $50 credit but I am hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: DebbieD

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST CELLPHONE EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: epic crap! if I take this crap to basement or some places which are not signal zone, it will still receive noting even I take back!! Never buy it!! It is crap!
customer_reviews.author: Peng Bao

customer_reviews.title: Phone
customer_reviews.text: I recieved my package with my phone in it a day earlier than I was expecting it to arrive. The product seemed to be fine when I first opened the box and nothing was damaged. I opened up the phone got it all set up and I am very happy with my purchase. If I ever want to buy something in the future I will definitely look on Amazon.com first.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Bad for a touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: The touchscreen is to small to use. The keypad is small and awkward. I paid the extra money and just bought a really nice phone. I'll be putting this one in the box.
customer_reviews.author: liveforknowledge

customer_reviews.title: I don't know whats going on with this thing?
customer_reviews.text: Okay i got the phone in, i charged it then it said full battery then i tried to take out the battery and it wouldn't come out then i eventually got it out. then i put in the sim card and popped the battery back on then i turnned on the phone then it loads up fine till i try to call or text someone and it won't work...is sim card activated? i looked at the phone settings and i dont even have a number? and i don't have $50 on the phone cuz nothing really popped up? so what the heck is going on?
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Worst Cellphone product I have ever purchased and horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought the LG Prime phone recently from Amazon.com. This is the worst cellphone product I have EVER purchased and the customer service offered by both LG and ATT is unacceptable. The phone is cheaply assembled and does not work properly. The browser function is horrible and when I called ATT to report my problems I was told to call LG or return the phone. I called LG and was told they would research the issue and get back with me. That was 5 weeks ago and they never got back with me. DO NOT buy this phone. It is JUNK and ATT support is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: williammc

customer_reviews.title: LG Prime Prepaid Gophone
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this phone! In fact, it was the easiest phone to operate that I've ever owned! As far as the "locking" device, I have no problem with that either , because I understand why it's being done...and for good reason. This make the EIGHTH cell phone that I've owned, and I can honestly say, by far this phone is the easiest to work. At first I had a little problem in figuring out how to set up my voice mail. I grabbed my little phone and drove straight back to AT& T store, and the sales person was more than happy to help me! F.Wright, Michigan
customer_reviews.author: F. K. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this phone yesterday, I've only been using it a few hours now but I absolutely love it! What an awesome phone for texting. It has the running conversation "bubbles" like the iphone does, but I find the touch qwerty keyboard easier to use than the iphone. I have no complaints yet, I need to work more with the camera there are numerous effects and options for it which was a pleasant surprise. Oh and I just popped in my SIM card from my old phone and the transition was super smooth. So far so good, just the texting alone is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A.

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm very happy with this phone. I'm not a phone person but I was fristrated with my old flip phone as I had difficulty seeing the screen and working the keys. I'm 63 and the eyes aren't what they once were. The phone is intuitive and once you have worked with it a bit very easy. Only issue I have with it is that the screen lock feature goes to standby pretty quick so I can't see the screen during a call. But that may be a setting I haven't found yet and as I said I'm not a big phone guy. The air time credit was a bonus. A very good, workable gophone.
customer_reviews.author: gecko

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Phone
customer_reviews.text: I had a Sony Ericsson w508i (Jungle Green) for 3 years. It was a great phone, but it was time for a replacement. The LG Prime is a pretty cool phone considering it's less than $100 and is a touch screen. I put in an 8GB memory card for music, pictures, etc; but sometimes the phone freezes/takes FOREVER to retrieve data and play music/view pictures. As much as I like the touch screen function, I think I would rather have bought a new Sony Ericsson. Also, I would recommend buying a silicone case and screen protector(s).
customer_reviews.author: Elyse C.

customer_reviews.title: Phone is garbage
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both got the LG prime phone, he hated his and gave it away and mine has frozen so many times I am getting a new phone. I am a home health nurse and need a reliable phone to use for work. It can be a life or death situation for me and my phone needs to work. I am going to walmart to buy a ten dollar gophone to use until I can get a better phone. I am so disappointed in at&t and amazon for selling this phone. LG should be ashamed of itself.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is wonderful. I bought this phone for my daughter and bought myself the LG Rumor Touch. My rumor is hard to get to certain things, such as contacts, e-mail and messaging. But the LG Prime is so easy to use. The touch screen is wonderful. I have since gotten rid of my Romor touch and ordered an LG Prime for myself. Also, it comes with a $50 money card. It's a great phone at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Gidget W

customer_reviews.title: best phone I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I never get phones with contracts to much hassle. Last phone was a ATT samsung and it got no service unless, you walked out side. The LG prime I get 4-5 bars inside and its the call is crystal clear, never had a call drop once. Phone is also great for text messaging takes awhile to get into the groove of it though. The conversation feature is nice you can few all the text messages from one person so you don't get your friends confused. phones great, its cheat and comes with a 50 dollar card its a steal
customer_reviews.author: Letha Harris

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: i got this phone in 2010 it was awesome. just didnt last mre than a year. touchpad calibration messed up where i couldnt put in my password so it didnt work. sucked. byt awesome phone. i miss my fm radio on it
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Monnier

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for $80 that included $50 free air time. Awesome deal! Uses standard ipod ear buds. Can listen to my favorite tunes and will still ring me if I get incoming call. Great full screen keyboard for texting. Screen scratches easily. Resistive screen not as good as capacitive screen. Overall, a great value.
customer_reviews.author: CC58

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price, it was something to tide me over while I replaced one that had been damaged. A good starter phone for the kids maybe.
customer_reviews.author: K Jones

customer_reviews.title: Issues
customer_reviews.text: This phone is pretty vanilla. I've had problems transferring photos to my computer via bluetooth. Some pics will send, some won't. I suppose the phone decides this for me. The screen response can be a bit tedious, i.e. when wanting to scroll through a contact list, it may simply initiate a call. Nothing to brag about.
customer_reviews.author: Stickslinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: This Phone Works Very Well, No Contract, Pay A Year In Advance No Monthly Payments Good Service That Is Why I Gave It Five Stars
customer_reviews.author: Neal Mccuistion

customer_reviews.title: This should just be a phone
customer_reviews.text: This should just be a phone and nothing else. It's look is like a smartphone, but it sure doesn't function like one.
customer_reviews.author: blahshmiah

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this phone for my wife. I wanted her to have a phone in case she needed one. The phone gets great signal where ever we are. AT&T offers alot of coverage. This phone offers alot. For the price Amazon offers for this deal, you can not go wrong. I liked the phone so much that I purchased one for me also. We would recommend this phone to anyone. I would like to THANK AMAZON for what they do for us to offer everyone out there a GREAT DEAL!! THANKS AMAZON!! Roger and Lynn
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Without typing a page long review,this phone is a better alternative to buying a smartphone with a contract or for around $400 with no commitment. All of the features work great and the phone has a good fm radio. It has a 3.5mm jack which works with the standard headphones so you wont have to buy special headphones. The only problem I have ran into is the sometimes short battery life. This phone has more to offer then some contracts. I recommend buying a micro sd card to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Is Everything

customer_reviews.title: Love my "sensitive" LG Prime phone
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good phone for the money. I use the SanDisc memory card and MP3 player a lot.....more than the phone. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: NellHR

customer_reviews.title: Bad Phone
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone for my son in college for a christmas gift. This phone has already stopped working and can't make phone calls. LG doesn't want to support there product. Also Amazon doesn't honor there own product that they sell. SO NEVER PURCHASE ANY PHONE FROM AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: Kizzypo

customer_reviews.title: for the price
customer_reviews.text: Phone is ok for the price, has a few irksome glitches and the $50 rebate is only available if you are a customer of AT&T for over 4 months. There is no mention of this in any of the sales information. Buyer beware of sales incentives without checking them out first.
customer_reviews.author: Friday Leopard

customer_reviews.title: "Inflated" price
customer_reviews.text: Neat phone. I was going to get another, but price was effectively raised $45. Was 69.99 with $50 credit. Now 79.99 with $15 credit. Incidentally, this is also now a misleading product listing, because previous reviews refer to a phone with a $50 credit. This one should be listed as a separate product.
customer_reviews.author: dbell154

customer_reviews.title: probably not what you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: Maybe its just me, but this phone sucks! I've had mine for awhile now, but wish I had of gone with almost anybody else. AT&T service sucks badly. If you want to get on the net, you better have deep pockets. They charge more then any other company I know of. I did however drop mine in the can once and after drying out, it was fine. I just dont like the touch screen or the service.
customer_reviews.author: waterrat1

customer_reviews.title: mimi in ms
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone. My first touch screen device. Fairly user friendly. Product arrived as scheduled and was quite a bit cheaper at Amazon than Wal-mart. Battery life is extremely long, compared with my previous ATT Motorola phone. Voice quality is excellent and seems to have fewer dropped calls and connection issues than my previous phone. Have had this phone 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stuart

customer_reviews.title: No WiFi you are locked into ATT rates for surfing.
customer_reviews.text: No wifi and you can not instal you own apps. For people who need either of those this is a no go..
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: WILL DEFINITELY BE COMING BACK
customer_reviews.text: I SEARCHED HIGH AND LOW FOR A GOOD DEAL ON THIS PHONE FOR MY BOYFRIEND FOR CHRISTMAS. HE LOVED IT! THE TOUCH SCREEN IS AWESOME AND SO ARE ALL THE DRAGGING FEATURES AND STUFF! THE PRODUCT ARRIVED CLEAN WITHOUT ANY DEFECTS, WHICH I DID NOT EXPECT, SINCE I ONLY PAID $70 COMPARED TO $150 ON AT&T.COM! I WILL DEFINITELY BE COMING BACK FOR MY CELL PHONE PURCHASES! LINDSEY
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Abbott

customer_reviews.title: ehh...
customer_reviews.text: I thot this phone was awesome....and it was for the first few months that I had it...then the touchscreen decided to stop working -__- so now it's completely useless :(
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: LG Prime
customer_reviews.text: I receiveed the LG Prime I ordered and could not be more pleased with the phone. This phone is a must have!!
customer_reviews.author: VMc

product_meta.title: LG Prime GS390 Feature phone AT&T
product_meta.description:
Send text, pictures and sound to share quick thoughts and pictures (messaging charges apply) with the LG Prime GoPhone. You can access to the latest music news and more via AT&T Music. Listen to stored music or tune into streaming radio for a mobile music experience (separate charges apply). You can view pictures and video taken with the 2.0MP camera. Plus you can access personal email including AOL, Yahoo!, Windows Live (data charges apply) with the AT&T LG Prime GoPhone. *SIM Card not included

AMAZON.COM


Sleek and solid, fun and functional, the LG Prime helps you stay connected whenever and wherever you roam thanks to the included AT&T Social Net application, which allows you to view and manage all your social networking connections and updates from Facebook, MySpace, and Twitter. It also features a bright touchscreen display, and 2-megapixel camera/camcorder for snapping pics and recording video on the go.

 



The LG Prime features a 3-inch touchscreen display and 2-megapixel camera/camcorder. 

Other features of the LG Prime include a multi-format digital audio player, an integrated FM radio, Bluetooth for hands-free devices and stereo music streaming, microSD memory expansion (to 16 GB), access to mobile e-mail and instant messaging services, and a rating of up to four hours of talk time.

PAY AS YOU GO WITH GOPHONE
With AT&T's GoPhone pay-as-you-go service, you get all the benefits of wireless without the surprises--no long-term contracts, credit checks, or deposits. You can easily refill your minutes via prepaid cards or the Internet, or choose to prepay each month and roll over unused minutes.

You can choose from a variety of plans that suit your individual needs--including monthly and daily plans with unlimited talk and text messaging as well as a simple per-minute plan. And with Rollover Balance, you can carry over your unused account balance when you refill before your balance expires, up to the account maximum (learn more below).

KEY FEATURES
 * EDGE data connectivity with average data speeds between 75-135Kbps--fast enough to support a range of data services including full picture messaging, Internet access, and e-mail on the go. 
 * 3-inch touchscreen display 
 * 2-megapixel camera/camcorder with up to 2x digital zoom 
 * Multi-format digital audio player compatible with MP3, WMA, and AAC/AAC+ formats 
 * Integrated FM radio 
 * Bluetooth connectivity (version 2.1) includes profiles for communication headset, hands-free car kits, and the A2DP Bluetooth profile--enabling you to wirelessly stream your music to a pair of compatible Bluetooth stereo headphones or speaker dock. 
 * Memory expansion via microSD card slot with support for optional cards up to 16 GB. 
 * Full messaging capabilities including SMS text, MMS picture and instant messaging (IM)--via popular services including AOL, Yahoo!, and Windows Live. 
 * Access to personal e-mail (AOL, Gmail, Yahoo!, and Windows Live) 
 *  
   
   Enjoy quick social networking access via AT&T Social Net. 
 * AT&T Social Net provides easy access to all your social networking sites including Facebook, Twitter, and MySpace in one easy-to-use interface. 
 * Web browser 
 * Voice dialing and voice command capabilities 
 * Organizer tools including calendar, alarm clock, tasks, world clock, and calculator. 
 * Airplane mode allows you to listen to music while the cellular connectivity is turned off. 
 * USB connectivity (cable not included) 
 * TTY/TTD compatible 
 * Hearing Aid (HAC) rating: M3/T3 

VITAL STATISTICS
The LG Prime weighs 3.14 ounces and measures 4.25 x 2.08 x 0.5 inches. Its 900 mAh lithium-ion battery is rated at up to four hours of talk time, and up to 384 hours (16 days) of standby time. It runs on the 850/900/1800/1900 MHz GSM/GPRS/EDGE frequencies.

What's in the Box
LG Prime handset, rechargeable battery, charger, quick start guide, user manual






AT&T GOPHONE SERVICE
AT&T's pay-as-you-go GoPhone plans are wireless plans made easy, simply pay in advance for what you need. No long-term contracts, credit checks, or surprise bills--just all the benefits of wireless, with no complications. In addition, AT&T's Rollover Balance feature lets you carry over your unused account balance when you purchase refill minutes before your balance expires. 

Other great GoPhone features include no long distance or roaming fees across AT&T's national service area, the ability to track usage via text messages with an updated balance after each call, and the ability to refill your minutes 24-hours a day, 7-days a week. You can also choose to add international long distance for calling to over 50 countries (including Mexico landlines and Canada) for just $10 for 250 minutes. And you can cancel any time without penalty.

GOPHONE PLAN OPTIONS
 * $50 Monthly Unlimited Plan includes unlimited talk, text (both U.S. and internationally), and access to Internet data and web browsing (smartphone users must purchase a separate data package). 
 * $25 Monthly Plan includes 250 minutes of talk time, unlimited text messages, and international texting at 25¢ per message. Data and mobile web browsing is charged per use, or you can buy a package. 
 * $2 Unlimited Daily Talk & Text is a good plan for those who do not use their phone every day, and data packages can be added. It's charged ONLY on days when the phone is used to make or receive a voice call (including a call to voice mailbox), use IM, or send a text or picture/video/sound message. Data is charged per use, or via a package.
 * Per Minute enables you to make phone calls at just 10¢ a minute--perfect for those looking to use their phone very infrequently or for emergencies. You can also send texts at 20¢ per message (25¢ per international message), or choose a monthly package. Data is charged per use, or via a package.

Smartphone users can use any of these GoPhone plans, however, a smartphone require a data/web package to use data/web services. Pay-per-use data/web is not available on smartphone devices. Data packages for all GoPhone plan options (for mobile web access for e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, and more) include the following:

 * 500 MB for $25 
 * 100 MB for $15 
 * 10 MB for $5 

Data packages are good for 30 days, as long as your account balance is not expired. Standard rates apply if feature package is not renewed after 30 days.

Learn more about AT&T GoPhone plans from this handy chart, plus check out AT&T's nationwide coverage map.

See (AT&T's coverage map). HOW TO REFILL YOUR ACCOUNT
For your convenience 24/7, you can add money to your account in a variety of ways and in a variety of amounts.

 * With Rollover Balance, if you refill your account before your balance expires, you keep your unused balance. 
 * Purchase a refill card at any AT&T store and over 200,000 other retail locations in the U.S. Most refill cards will let you dial *888* to refill using the PIN number on the card. 
 * Use a credit/debit card and visit att.com/mygophone to refill online. You can also set up Auto Refill and Text to Refill, which enables you to refill directly from your phone. 

To check on your current balance, dial*777# and press SEND to receive a text massage indicating your account balance and expiration date.

AT&T GoPhone refill cards are available in these amounts:

 * $15 (30-day expiration) 
 * $25 (90-day expiration) 
 * $50 (90-day expiration) 
 * $60 (90-day expiration) 
 * $100 (1-year expiration)
feature_bullets: Cheap Basic Affordable Burner Cell phone
Pay for just the minutes you use with no annual contract--easy refill via Internet or prepaid cards
2-megapixel camera/camcorder; Bluetooth stereo music; microSD expansion to 16 GB; access to personal e-mail and instant messaging services
Up to 4 hours of talk time, up to 384 hours (16 days) of standby time; released in June, 2010 What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, charger, operating instructions
